file_content.text: We're putting the screws to those researchers you brought in. Their information will give us just the thing to make the Republic squirm.
You're wrong, I'm nothing like you! What we did had value. It was for science!
Ah, science--a convenient bastion for the truly amoral. We'll see how detached you can be when you're under the lens, doctor.
Most of the scientists are already in their cells. Armed with their knowledge, the Empire will be better prepared for any aliens we encounter.
I hope those researchers were worth my time.
Then it is done.
Absolutely. On behalf of Imperial Intelligence, you have our gratitude.
Prove what happened on Belsavis. The Republic citizens will want justice.
Expose the Republic's deeds.
Of course. I'm sure the Diplomatic Service has plans of its own for this information.
You're lucky I was bored.
I understand completely. You must be very busy, so I won't detain you further.
You've got to bring in the rest of the scientists. The information's no good without corroboration.
The Republic is moving on those researchers. Get out there and recover them before it's too late.
Look out there--hundreds of aliens in a savage fight for supremacy.
Clever of the Republic to use a prison planet as the perfect secret laboratory. Test subjects abound, no witnesses who aren't complicit....
...an elegant experiment, forcing imprisoned aliens to fight each other for dominance. Now they're loose.
This experiment doesn't sound like the Republic at all.
The Republic did that?
Which is why they did it here. They had their finest scientists on the job, the best chemical cocktails to ramp up aggression.
What was the point of the experiment?
Why make aliens fight?
To learn, of course. Here, they did everything to increase aggression among the aliens, then turned them on each other.
You're boring me.
The scientists studied what each alien could take and what they could dish out, learned the breaking point of each species.
Think what the Empire could do with that knowledge--to know which species can be soldiers and which are fit only as slaves.
It could help the Empire plan its expansion.
The study could be valuable.
Imperial Intelligence agrees--they want to talk to the scientists involved and uncover everything they know.
Surely the Republic can't get away with this abomination.
It's an atrocity.
A lot of Republic citizens will agree with you--that's why Intelligence wants to extract confessions from the research scientists.
Tell me where I fit in.
Imperial Intelligence wants to talk to those scientists--that's where you come in.
Normally the Republic scientists are well guarded, but aliens overpowered the guards and took the researchers hostage.
The Republic has yet to negotiate their release, so your team could overpower the aliens and bring the scientists back alive.
The Republic is negotiating their release, but a Sith Lord could overpower the aliens and recover the scientists.
We cannot risk losing this opportunity. I'll retrieve the scientists personally.
Very well, I'll do it.
You honor us, my lord. The aliens have infested a cave on the edge of the jungle--it's a good place to start.
While the Republic figures out how to react, you could recover the scientists for the Empire. Alive, that is.
Just let me know where to find these scientists, I'll bring them back.
I'll do it.
The Republic is negotiating their release, but a Cipher agent could slip in and capture the scientists before they can act.
The Republic is negotiating their release, but someone like you might slip in and capture the scientists before they can act.
The scientists are too valuable to risk losing them. I'll recover them personally.
Very well, I'll do it.
You'll want to start looking in the caves near the jungle--the aliens use them as a base of sorts.
Republic troops, scientists and aliens? This could go badly wrong.
It seems risky, but all right.
The Empire trusts you to see that it doesn't. Look for the aliens near the jungle caves, they seem to camp there.
Once you've dealt with them, you'll be able to gather up the scientists. These neural-override collars will force them to return here.
Don't presume. [Refuse quest]
Of course, I understand completely. Forgive me for having bothered you.
I can see why the Republic kept this place a secret. Everyone would want to live here.
